result.execSummary:
The defendant Rebecca Jo Lutz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Rebecca Jo Lutz is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Rebecca Jo Lutz was found guilty of Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court dismisses Counts 1, 3 and 4.
Court dismisses 15CF542, 15CF537, 15CF550, 15CF526 and 15CF562.
Concurrent without prejudice to consecutive if revoked.
Defendant to report to Probation immediately upon release and the to Birkwood Treatment Center.
Court notes 85 days credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with:

miscConds.notes:
Inclusive of costs.
Apply bond on file.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Any other programming recommended by Agent.
-NO CONTACT whatsoever with Sarah Fonseca except when other family members are present or at a family gathering.
-Successfully complete program at Birkwood Treatment Center.
-Defendant to follow any aftercare program.
-Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
-Random and regular testing.
-Defendant to submit a DNA sample.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Katie J. Christiansen DF: Rebecca Jo Lutz appeared from jail. Case called at 10:04. Court reviews file. PSI has been waived. ADA Minser gives sentencing recommendations. Atty. Christiansen gives recommendations. 

Court orders:  Sentence W/H
On 15CF447 and 15CF520
3 years probation with conditions.
Probation is concurrent without prejudice to consecutive sentencing in the event of Probation revocation.
- Upon release from jail DE to be release immediately to probation and then to Birkwood Treatment facility. 
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times  This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- AODA
- Any other programming recommended by agent. 
- DE have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sarah Fonseca except when other family members are present or at a family gathering. The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person. 
- Successfully complete program at Burkwood Treatment Center.
- DE to follow any aftercare program.
- Not to associate with any persons known or suspected to be involved in use, trafficking, dealing or manufacturing of illegal drugs except in a treatment setting.
- Random and regular testing.
- $1500 inclusive of costs 
- Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.
  Apply bond on file return remainder to payor. 

 Court notes 85 days credit against any ultimate sentence.
signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson.ADA:  Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Katie J. Christiansen and DF ATTY: Alex Stormont  DF:  Rebecca Jo Lutz appeared from jail. Case called at 3:49. Includes 15CF520(ARGN), 15CF526 (ARGN),  15CF537(STC), 15CF542(STC), 15CF447(STC), 15CF550(STC) and 15CF562(STC). ADA Minser updates the court. Court reads charge and maximum penalty in 15CF520 and 15CF526. DE pleads G to Ct 2 in 15CF447 and G to 15CF520. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 2 in 15CF447 and guilty of 15CF520. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 15CF542, 15CF537, 15CF550, 15CF562, Ct 1,3,4 in 15CF447 and 15CF526. Court dismisses any additional counts in the 15CF520 file. . 

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Final pre-trial at 02-09-2016 04:00 pm
From Atty Christiansen. Requesting PH be changed to a Status. km

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Katie Christiansen Alex Stormont DF: Rebecca Jo Lutz appeared from jail. Case called at 4:33. Includes 15CF520, 15CF526, 15CF537, 15CF542, 15CF447 and 15CF550. Atty. Christiansen updates the court and presents the Court with a proposed Order. ADA Minser does not object. Ms. Heinbuch agrees to release the money to be used for treatment. Court orders $12,600 to Birkwood Treatment Center to be freed up to allow DE to be used for treatment. Court signs the order. Bond will be modified to be reduced by $12,600.
Bail/bond hearing at 01-29-2016 04:30 pm

**AMENDED**
Includes 15CF447, 15CF526, 15CF537, and 15CF542.  

- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- Report every Mon. Wed. and Sat. before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex and provide a valid/verified UA sample.  If UA tests positive or a valid/verified sample is not provided, defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

- It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sarah Fonseca.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Edward Minser DF ATTY: Katie J. Christiansen DF: Rebecca Jo Lutz appeared from jail. Case called at 10:08. Includes 15CF508 (PH), 15CF520 (PH), 15CF526 (PH), 15CF537 (STC), 15CF542 (STC), and 15CF447 (STC and is scheduled for FPT on 02-12-2015). Court reviews file. Branch 2 has transferred files to Branch 3 to conduct prelim. 

On 15CF508 ADA Minser responds to the complaint and would like to amend to failure to comply with UA testing instead of failure to commit any new crimes. Atty. Christiansen responds. Court will dismiss 15CF508 entirely. The $500 in 15CF508 will stand as bond.

On 15CF520 S/T Deputy A. Neumann. Direct by ADA Minser. ADA Minser request the Court to take judicial notice of 15CF447 and all of Branch 3 files. Deputy Neumann identifies the DE in court. Cross by Atty. Christiansen. ADA Minser request bind over.  Atty. Christiansen argues. ADA Minser responds. Atty. Christiansen responds. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.

On 15CF526 S/T Deputy T. Mark. Direct by ADA Minser. ADA Minser request Court to take judicial notice of the bond on it's files. Deputy Mark identifies the DE in court. Cross by Atty. Christiansen. Court questions officer. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and the DF probably committed that felony and binds over for trial.

Post an additional $100,000.00 and $15,000.00 bond on file.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Sarah F.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Report every  Monday, Wednesday and Saturday before 5:00pm  to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
